intro: Stenosemia cicutaria, commonly known as the water dropwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, showcasing its adaptability to moist environments. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slight wing-like appearance, contributing to its common name. Stenosemia cicutaria is often found in temperate regions and plays a role in supporting local insect populations.
